column1: Yes, members can use HTML in their posts.

These settings are applied on a per
member level basis. Start by selecting the member level you want to modify,
then adjust the settings for that level below. Note that settings on this page
override the abilities granted to moderators. If you select "No" to an option,
even moderators will not be able to perform that action. Conversely, if you
select the "Yes, even private ones"/"Yes, including other members'" options,
they will be able to perform that action even if they are not a moderator.
Do you want to let users view forums? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.

column1: Yes, allow viewing and subscription of forums.
column2: Yes, allow viewing and subscription of forums.

column1: No, do not allow forum to be viewed or subscribed to.
column2: No, do not allow forum to be viewed or subscribed to.
Do you want to allow users to create topics in forums?

column1: Yes, allow creation of topics in forums, even private ones.
column2: Yes, allow creation of topics in forums, even private ones.

column1: No, do not allow topics to be created.
column2: No, do not allow topics to be created.
Do you want to allow users to edit topics in forums?

column1: Yes, allow editing of topics in forums, including other members' topics.
column2: Yes, allow editing of topics in forums, including other members' topics.

column1: No, do not allow topics to be edited.
column2: No, do not allow topics to be edited.
Do you want to allow users to delete topics in forums?

column1: Yes, allow deletion of topics in forums, including other members' topics.
column2: Yes, allow deletion of topics in forums, including other members' topics.

column1: No, do not allow topics to be deleted.
column2: No, do not allow topics to be deleted.

Do you want to allow users to post to the forums? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply. This is useful if you want users to be able to view forums and manage their subscriptions, but only want certain levels to be able to create forums.

column1: No, do not allow forum posts.
column2: No, do not allow forum posts.
Do you want to allow users to edit posts in forums?

column1: Yes, allow editing of posts, including other members' posts.
column2: Yes, allow editing of posts, including other members' posts.

column1: No, do not allow forum posts to be edited.
column2: No, do not allow forum posts to be edited.
Do you want to allow users to delete posts in forums?

column1: Yes, allow deletion of posts, including other members' posts.
column2: Yes, allow deletion of posts, including other members' posts.

column1: No, do not allow forum posts to be deleted.
column2: No, do not allow forum posts to be deleted.

If you have disabled HTML in posts but want to allow specific tags, you can enter them below (separated by commas). If you have enabled HTML in posts, this setting will have no effect.  Example: b, img, a, embed, font

This email is sent to the member when people reply to forum topics that the member created.
A member has posted a reply to your topic "[object_title]" in the forum "[object_parent_title]"

[header]

[sender_title] has posted a reply to your topic "[object_title]" in the forum "[object_parent_title]":

"[message]"

Please click the following link to view it:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
